intro: Leucadendron glabrum, commonly known as the silver tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-white, feathery foliage and produces small, yellowish flowers in cone-like structures. The plant is part of the Proteaceae family and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance makes it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, requiring minimal water once established.
